feed.title: SAP Community - ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model
feed.subtitle: ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: sap Cloud authorization Object problem because of namespace to long /asdfghjk/
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are working in ABAP Cloud and created a custom namespace with 8 characters:

/asdfghjk/
(10 characters total including the slashes)

We already have thousands of CDS views and other objects created under this namespace.

At the final stage of a complex development, we now need to implement CDS Access Control .
For this, we need to create 4 authorization objects and reference them in CDS access controls.

Problem

Authorization object names are limited to 10 characters, and our namespace alone already consumes all 10 characters:

/asdfghjk/

Because of this:

  • We cannot create authorization objects in this namespace (no space left for a name).

  • CDS Access Controls under /asdfghjk/ can only reference authorization objects from the same namespace.

What we tried

  1. Create a shorter namespace /abc/

    • ✔ We can create authorization objects

    • ❌ We cannot use them in CDS Access Controls under /asdfghjk/ because namespaces differ

  2. Create Z authorization objects*

    • ❌ Same issue: CDS Access Controls in /asdfghjk/ can only reference objects from /asdfghjk/

Constraint

We cannot move all existing objects from /asdfghjk/ to a shorter namespace — this would involve thousands of objects and is not feasible.

Question

Is there any recommended solution or workaround for this situation in ABAP Cloud?

  • Is there a way to reference authorization objects from a different namespace in CDS Access Control?

  • Is there an SAP-recommended approach for long namespaces and authorization objects?

  • Or is this a known limitation with a documented workaround?

Any guidance or best practice would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Fiori Elements Objectpage Extension: Manipulate data received from backend odata service
entry.content:
Is there a way to intercept & manipulate data received from backend oData service, before it is rendered on a Smarttable on the Objectpage UI?

This is for an app built based on Fiori Elements List report, which navigates to a detailed Object page as default behavior. Object page has a Smarttable built using ABAP CDS annotations (UI.facet.type = #LINEITEM_REFERENCE) https://help.sap.com/docs/abap-cloud/abap-rap/using-facets-to-change-object-page-layout

I added a controller extension to the Object page and I am able to receive various events triggered during data fetch. I tried using datareceived & requestcompleted

Both these events are triggered too late and after update. I would like to know if there is any other way to intercept the oData call to manipulate data.

If there is no way to do this, is it possible to set up a mock server, to act as a bridge between the UI and actual backend? Are there any risks of using a mock server for this purpose in a Productive environment?

entry.title: aggregation of currency coloumn is not happening using annotation @DefaultAggregation: #SUM
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I have created custom CDS view entity, I have used the annotation @DefaultAggregation: #SUM to display the total of transaction currency and few more currency fields. I have added the below code in my CDS. when I ran the application, I'm not able to see the aggregation data in the bottom.

 

  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [  { entity:  { name: 'I_CurrencyStdVH', element: 'Currency' }
                                 }]
@UI.fieldGroup: [{ qualifier: '_AMOUNT1_QUANTITY', groupLabel: 'Amount and Quantity Fields', position: 15, exclude: false, importance: #HIGH, type: #STANDARD }]
@ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_TransactionCurrency'
//@Semantics.currencyCode:true
ac.rwcur as TransactionCurrency,

@UI.fieldGroup: [{ qualifier: '_AMOUNT1_QUANTITY', groupLabel: 'Amount and Quantity Fields', position: 02, exclude: false, importance: #HIGH, type: #STANDARD }]
@ObjectModel.filter.enabled: true
@DefaultAggregation: #SUM
@Semantics: { amount : {currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'} } 
@UI.lineItem: [{position:120}]
ac.wsl as  AmountInTransactionCurrency,

 

I referred the below url to display the total of all currency column.
Annotating Aggregate Functions in CDS | SAP Help Portal

I feel the problem in commenting the below code. 

 

//@Semantics.currencyCode:true

 

If I uncommented the coded I'm getting below error.

"Annotation Semantics.currencyCode is not allowed in view entities."

This because I used the view entity.

May I know what I missed here? and how to resolve the issue?

Thanks,

Dhina.

entry.title: Auto fill "Created At" for date using Semantics annotations is not working in RAP
entry.content:
I have created a simple managed RAP application from a custom table which has a field called ERDAT. I want this field to be auto-filled whenever a user creates a new record.

I added the below semantic annotation in my root view entity (for ERDAT field)

 

define root view entity ZR_Sales_Header as select from YI_SALESORD_HDR_TEST
composition[1..*] of YI_SALES_ITEM as  _SalesOrdItem
association[0..1] to I_OverallSDProcessStatusText as _OverallProcStatusText
  on  $projection.GBSTK = _OverallProcStatusText.OverallSDProcessStatus 
  and _OverallProcStatusText.Language = $session.system_language
association[1..1] to ZI_CustomerNameText as _CustomerName
  on $projection.KUNNR = _CustomerName.Customer  
{
    key VBELN,
    @Semantics.systemDate.createdAt: true
    ERDAT,

The field name in DB table and CDS view entity is same (ERDAT) so no mapping is provided in RAP behaviour definition

In RAP Behv Definition, read only is applied for this field.

field ( readonly ) VBELN, ERDAT;

But when I run the app and try to create and save a new record, the field ERDAT comes are ready only but it does not get populated with the date and instead a blank value in this field gets saved in the DB table.

Also to add the data type of ERDAT in my database table is DATUM only.

Can anyone kindly point out what mistake I am doing here.

entry.title: Storing of documents in database table
entry.content:
In S/4 HANA Public Cloud, I'm developing a custom fiori app that will create a contract upon approval. This app also allows uploading of attachments like pdf files. While transaction is waiting for approval, all information are stored in a custom database table. 

I know there is a DMS in BTP which allow uploading of file without any business object but client is on a budget and cannot afford.

I understand that API_ATTACHMENT_SRV only allow uploading of file when linked to a business object. But in my case, the business object is not yet created.

I'm thinking if I just convert the file into binary rawstring and store it in a custom database in the meantime. Then use the attachment api to upload the file and link it to the created business object and deleting it from the db table.

is it advisable to do this method?

what are the possible implications of doing this method?

entry.title: SAP Version Compatibility for LOB Attachments in RAP
entry.content:
In an ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP)–based custom application, I am using the attachment functionality.

I need to verify whether Large Object (LOB) handling is supported and functional in the current SAP system.

Could you please confirm from which SAP S/4HANA versions the LOB (Large Object) functionality is supported and available for use in RAP-based applications?

ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model  ABAP Development ABAP Development SAP Quality Issue Management SAP BTP ABAP environment

entry.title: Creating ServiceOrder via I_SERVICEORDERTP
entry.content:
Hi,

I am creating Serviceorders via I_SERVICEORDERTP.

Im using basically the example code thats given in the documentation.

DATA: lt_order_to_create            TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE i_serviceordertp,
          lt_item_to_create_cba         TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE i_serviceordertp\_serviceorderitemtp,
          ls_item_to_create_cba         LIKE LINE OF lt_item_to_create_cba,
          lt_item_target                LIKE ls_item_to_create_cba-%target,
          lt_refobj_to_create_cba       TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE i_serviceordertp\_srvcordreferenceobjecttp,
          ls_refobj_to_create_cba       LIKE LINE OF lt_refobj_to_create_cba,
          lt_refobj_target              LIKE ls_refobj_to_create_cba-%target,
          lt_priceelement_to_create_cba TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE i_serviceordertp\_srvcordpriceelementtp,
          ls_priceelement_to_create_cba LIKE LINE OF lt_priceelement_to_create_cba,
          lt_priceelement_target        LIKE ls_priceelement_to_create_cba-%target,
          lt_item_refobj_cba            TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE i_serviceorderitemtp\_srvcorditemreferenceobjecttp,
          ls_item_refobj_cba            LIKE LINE OF lt_item_refobj_cba,
          lt_item_refobj_target         LIKE ls_item_refobj_cba-%target,
          lt_priceitem_cba              TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE i_serviceorderitemtp\_srvcorditempriceelementtp,
          ls_priceitem_cba              LIKE LINE OF lt_priceitem_cba,
          lt_priceitem_cba_target       LIKE ls_priceitem_cba-%target.

    INSERT VALUE #( %cid = 'CID_HDR'
                    serviceordertype     = 'SRVO'
                    serviceorderdescription = 'Service Order using EML'
                    language                = 'E'
                    soldtoparty             = '17100001'
                    salesorganization       = '1010'
                    division                = '00'
                    distributionchannel     = '10'
                    %control = VALUE #( serviceordertype        = cl_abap_behv=>flag_changed
                                        serviceorderdescription = cl_abap_behv=>flag_changed
                                        language                = cl_abap_behv=>flag_changed
                                        soldtoparty             = cl_abap_behv=>flag_changed
                                        salesorganization       = cl_abap_behv=>flag_changed
                                        division                = cl_abap_behv=>flag_changed
                                        distributionchannel     = cl_abap_behv=>flag_changed )
                  ) INTO TABLE lt_order_to_create.

    INSERT VALUE #( %cid = 'CID_ITEM'
                    product  = 'SRV_01'
                    quantity = '1'
                  ) INTO TABLE lt_item_target.

    IF lt_item_target IS NOT INITIAL.
      INSERT  VALUE #( %cid_ref = 'CID_HDR'
                       %target  = lt_item_target
                     ) INTO TABLE lt_item_to_create_cba.
    ENDIF.

    INSERT VALUE #( %cid  = 'CID_HDR_REFOBJ'
                    servicereferenceequipment = '000000000010000009' ) INTO TABLE lt_refobj_target.


    IF lt_refobj_target IS NOT INITIAL.
      INSERT  VALUE #( %cid_ref = 'CID_HDR'
                       %target  = lt_refobj_target
                      ) INTO TABLE lt_refobj_to_create_cba.
    ENDIF.

    INSERT VALUE #( %cid  = 'CID_HDR_PRICEELE'
                    conditiontype = 'DRV1'
                    conditionratevalue = '45'
                    conditioncurrency = 'EUR' ) INTO TABLE lt_priceelement_target.

    IF lt_priceelement_target IS NOT INITIAL.
      INSERT  VALUE #( %cid_ref = 'CID_HDR'
                       %target  = lt_priceelement_target
                     ) INTO TABLE lt_priceelement_to_create_cba.
    ENDIF.

    INSERT VALUE #( %cid  = 'CID_ITEM_REFOBJ'
                    servicereferenceequipment = '000000000010000009' ) INTO TABLE lt_item_refobj_target.

    IF lt_item_refobj_target IS NOT INITIAL.
      INSERT VALUE #( %cid_ref = 'CID_ITEM'
                      %target  = lt_item_refobj_target ) INTO TABLE lt_item_refobj_cba.
    ENDIF.

    INSERT VALUE #( %cid  = 'CID_ITEM_PRICEELE'
                    conditiontype = 'DRV1'
                    conditionratevalue = '45'
                    conditioncurrency = 'EUR' ) INTO TABLE lt_priceitem_cba_target.

    IF lt_priceitem_cba_target IS NOT INITIAL.
      INSERT VALUE #( %cid_ref = 'CID_ITEM'
                      %target  = lt_priceitem_cba_target ) INTO TABLE lt_priceitem_cba.
    ENDIF.

    MODIFY ENTITIES OF i_serviceordertp
     ENTITY serviceorder
       CREATE FROM lt_order_to_create
       CREATE BY \_serviceorderitemtp FROM lt_item_to_create_cba
       CREATE BY \_srvcordreferenceobjecttp FROM lt_refobj_to_create_cba
       CREATE BY \_srvcordpriceelementtp FROM lt_priceelement_to_create_cba
     ENTITY serviceorderitem
       CREATE BY \_srvcorditemreferenceobjecttp FROM lt_item_refobj_cba
       CREATE BY \_srvcorditempriceelementtp   FROM lt_priceitem_cba
         MAPPED DATA(mapped_modify)
         FAILED DATA(failed_modify)
         REPORTED DATA(reported_modify).

    COMMIT ENTITIES
      RESPONSE OF i_serviceordertp
      FAILED DATA(failed_commit)
      REPORTED DATA(reported_commit).

 

The Serviceorders are created with an error. The "EnterpriseServiceOrg" field is not set. The EnterpriseServiceOrg field is missing in the corresponging table ( lt_order_to_create ). 

My Question:

Is there a way to set the EnterpriseServiceOrg field?

Thanks

entry.title: How to create Business Configuration Maintenance Object / Cusomizing with header and child?
entry.content:
Hello, 

i want to create a Business configuration Maintenance Object via the adt generation wizard. Therefore i defined an header (*_status_clas & Child (*_status_code) table. 

After generation i only get the header and not the relationship to the child defined in the table.  I would expect that the generator is able to get the relationship (header-child) from the foreign key and creates the front end accordingly. 

When i tried the same for text tables it worked without any problems.

entry.title: JSON Payload Download Implementation in RAP Application
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

I am currently working on a custom RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model) Application in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. In this application, we use an API to send data to an external portal.

Now there is a new requirement when the user clicks a button, the JSON payload that is used in the ABAP program for sending data via the API should be downloaded in JSON format.

For this purpose, I have already created a custom action in the Behavior Definition, and the button is visible in the Application. My question is how to implement the download functionality so that the same JSON payload used for the API call can be downloaded by the user in JSON format and Also, please explain how to implement the JSON download functionality in the RAP application with step by step guidance.

Thank you,

entry.title: RAP Fiori Elements List Report Page with Analytical Table - How to?
entry.content:
Hi community,

I’m currently trying to implement a Fiori Elements List Report based on RAP and OData V4 and I’m struggling to align the current technical limitations with what is announced on the SAP roadmap.

My requirement

I need a generated Fiori Elements application that provides:

  • a List Report
    • using an Analytical Table
    • showing totals and subtotals for measures (amounts / quantities with currency or unit)
    • while still allowing create / update operations on the underlying business data via RAP

In other words:
👉Aggregations (totals/subtotals) and editability in the same List Page.

Roadmap reference

According to the SAP Roadmap (Q3 2025):

Support for analytical tables
Use analytical tables to provide users with totals and subtotals in applications
Feature is delivered as described in the documentation: Tables – SAPUI5 SDK

Based on this roadmap entry, I would assume that using an AnalyticalTable in a Fiori Elements List Report is now intended to be a supported and productive option.

What I experience in practice

  • When using a transactional RAP BO (provider contract transactional_query) as the data source:
    • editing works as expected
    • but configuring the table as AnalyticalTable leads to aggregation-related errors
      (e.g. “Aggregation not supported for this entity type” or
      “Property ‘Currency’ is not flagged as custom aggregate”)
    • When switching to an analytical query view (@analytics.query: true😞
      • totals and subtotals work
      • but the entity becomes read-only, so editing is no longer possible
    • The Annotations @odata.applySupportedForAggregation: #FULL
      (mentioned in this scenario) is not permitted in RAP CDS view entities.

My open questions

  1. With the roadmap item marked as delivered:
    1. is it now officially supported to use an Analytical Table in a Fiori Elements List Report on top of a transactional RAP BO?
  2. If yes: what is the recommended architecture?
    1. a single transactional RAP BO with analytical capabilities?

    2. or still a separation between analytical (read-only) and transactional entities?

  3. If not: does the roadmap item only refer to UI5 analytical tables in general, but not to RAP-based, editable Fiori Elements List Reports yet?

Any clarification on the intended usage and current limitations would be highly appreciated.

Thanks a lot in advance and best regards;
Sarah

entry.title: CDS Custom entity - clicking on line item always shows the Header entity name
entry.content:
Hi,

I am developing a custom entity based RAP development which displays Job details in a header report. by clicking on the header row, it takes to the line item report. 

But the report always points to the Parent entity name when clicking on the line item report.

Request your support to identify the issue. Thank you in advance.

Best Regards,

Shankar Sanke.

entry.title: RAP EML to update Equipment Classification Characteristic value does not work
entry.content:
Dear all,

I have a SAP S4 HANA Public Cloud environment. In a ABAP Class method, I have following RAP EML code to update the characteristic value of a Technical object Equipment.

DATA: lt_update TYPE TABLE FOR UPDATE i_equipmentclfncharvaluetp.
SELECT SINGLE
    equipment,
    classtype,
    classinternalid,
    charcinternalid,
    clfncharcvaluepositionnumber
  FROM i_equipmentclfncharvaluetp
  WHERE equipment      = '000000000010000228'
    AND characteristic = 'PRODUCT_STATUS_NAME'
  INTO @DATA(ls_db).

lt_update = VALUE #(
  ( %tky-%key-equipment                      = ls_db-equipment
    %tky-%key-classtype                      = ls_db-classtype
    %tky-%key-classinternalid                = ls_db-classinternalid
    %tky-%key-charcinternalid                = ls_db-charcinternalid
    %tky-%key-clfncharcvaluepositionnumber   = ls_db-clfncharcvaluepositionnumber
    charcvalue = '02' 
    %control-charcvalue = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
  )
).

MODIFY ENTITIES OF i_equipmenttp
  ENTITY equipmentclassfctncharcsvalue
  UPDATE FROM lt_update
  FAILED   DATA(lt_failed)
  REPORTED DATA(lt_reported).

COMMIT ENTITIES
  RESPONSE OF i_equipmenttp
  FAILED   DATA(lt_commit_failed)
  REPORTED DATA(lt_commit_reported).

The Equipment and Characteristic name as well as the value to be updated (CharcValue = '2' ) are all correct but still the code does not work. In the lt_commit_reported internal table, It keeps giving me error "No value was assigned to "Product Status"".

If I call an Equipment API with same details via POSTMAN , the update works as expected and no issues there.

Can someone help here and see what am i missing please?

Br

sapdevnl

entry.title: SAP Change document integration on RAP - I_ChangeDocument_2 is not released
entry.content:
Sometimes I dont understant SAP

im trying to achieve change document integrations on my custom RAP development.  ABAP Cloud on BTP

im following SAP documentation

https://help.sap.com/docs/abap-cloud/abap-rap/integrating-change-documents

https://help.sap.com/docs/abap-cloud/abap-rap/displaying-change-documents-on-ui

but im facing error -> The use of CDS Entity I_ChangeDocument_2 is not permitted.

and i found the note https://me.sap.com/notes/0003337092 that says "The views I_ChangeDocument_2, I_ChangeDocument, I_ChangeDocumentItem are technical views which only used internally and it is not planned to release them"

so , what should i do to achieve the change documents integration?

@Madhumathi_ any idea? im also following your blog

entry.title: Disable custom action button when a field value changed in SAP Fiori Elements
entry.content:
I have a custom action implemented in manifest.json

 "_Attachment/@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem": {
   "actions": {
     "idUploadAtt": {
       "press": ".extension.xxx.ext.controller.ObjectPage.onAttachmentUpload",
       "visible": true,
       "enabled": ".extension.xxx.ext.controller.ObjectPage.onAttachmentUploadEnable",
       "requiresSelection": false,
       "text": "Add a Link"
     }
   }
 }

i have the handler implemented in the controller extension. 

I need the custom action button dynamically enable/disable based from one of the field values in the object page. If value is blank, custom action button is disabled and vice versa.

However, I checked that the handler in the controller extension is only triggered during routing to the object page or changing to edit mode. It does not trigger when the field value is changed.

Can you advise how can I trigger the handler during field value change?

entry.title: Visualisation Draft record Odata V2 versus Odata V4
entry.content:
hey,

we've written an application in RAP Odata V2 with draft. On the overview page,  under the draft record, stood the word "Concept".

We've converted our application from V2 to V4, and now the word "Concept" has disappeared. I've read that their should appear a pencil at the left of the record, but I don't see this. 

Is there something special we have to do to obtain this pencil, or any indication to show this is a DRAFT record?

Thanks a lot,

Helga

entry.title: Pre-configured sorting order for Child entity in RAP
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I am creating a simple RAP application. I am facing issue while pre-configuring the sorting order for the child entity entries. 

I analyzed some of the demo applications provided by SAP but could not find the relevant examples. Also tried to search for the old posts with same query but could not find.

Could you please guide me in this regard.

My application has 2 entities. CASE – Parent entity and FORMS – Child entity.

Metadata extension for the parent (Case) entity

 

 It is correctly pre-sorting the table entries as per the annotations.

 

Metadata extension for the child (Forms) entity

 

But it is not pre-sorting the table entries.
